alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 25 at 2:56PM MST until November 26 at 8:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM SATURDAY TO 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches at pass level, and up to 9 inches above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM MST Saturday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM Saturday to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Gusty winds will combine with the falling snow to cause very poor visibility at times. Blowing snow is expected to reduce visibility at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving.
